net.opentsdb.meta

Class TSUIDQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.meta.TSUIDQuery

  • public class TSUIDQuery
extends Object
    Methods for querying the tsdb-meta table. This can be used to figure out what time series are actually stored as well as fetch TSMeta objects or optimize queries against the data table.
    Since:
    2.1

    • Method Detail

      • setQuery

        public void setQuery(String metric,
            HashMap<String,String> tags)
        Sets the query to perform
        Parameters:
        metric - Name of the metric to search for
        tags - A map of tag value pairs or simply an empty map
        Throws:
        NoSuchUniqueName - if the metric or any of the tag names/values did not exist

      • getLastWriteTimes

        public com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<org.hbase.async.Bytes.ByteMap<Long>> getLastWriteTimes()
        Fetches a list of TSUIDs given the metric and optional tag pairs. The query format is similar to TsdbQuery but doesn't support grouping operators for tags. Only TSUIDs that had "ts_counter" qualifiers will be returned.
        Returns:
        A map of TSUIDs to the last timestamp (in milliseconds) when the "ts_counter" was updated. Note that the timestamp will be the time stored by HBase, not the actual timestamp of the data point
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the metric was not set or the tag map was null

      • getTSMetas

        public com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<List<TSMeta>> getTSMetas()
        Returns all TSMeta objects stored for timeseries defined by this query. The query is similar to TsdbQuery without any aggregations. Returns an empty list, when no TSMetas are found. Only returns stored TSMetas.
        Returns:
        A list of existing TSMetas for the timeseries covered by the query.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When either no metric was specified or the tag map was null (Empty map is OK).

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getLastPoint

        public static com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<IncomingDataPoint> getLastPoint(TSDB tsdb,
                                                             byte[] tsuid,
                                                             boolean resolve_names,
                                                             int max_lookups,
                                                             long last_timestamp)
        Attempts to retrieve the last data point for the given TSUID. This operates by checking the meta table for the #COUNTER_QUALIFIER and if found, parses the HBase timestamp for the counter (i.e. the time when the counter was written) and tries to load the row in the data table for the hour where that timestamp would have landed. If the counter does not exist or the data row doesn't exist or is empty, the results will be a null IncomingDataPoint. Note: This will be accurate most of the time since the counter will be updated at the time a data point is written within a second or so. However if the user is writing historical data, putting data with older timestamps or performing an import, then the counter timestamp will be inaccurate.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to which we belong
        tsuid - TSUID to fetch
        resolve_names - Whether or not to resolve the TSUID to names and return them in the IncomingDataPoint
        max_lookups - If set to a positive integer, will look "max_lookups" hours into the past for a valid data point starting with the current hour. Setting this to 0 will only use the TSUID counter timestamp.
        last_timestamp - Optional timestamp in milliseconds when the last data point was written
        Returns:
        An IncomingDataPoint if data was found, null if not
        Throws:
        NoSuchUniqueId - if one of the tag lookups failed
